heading: Is Tzatziki gluten free?
intro: This public analysis report explains the biggest gluten risks in Tzatziki and how to order more safely.

verdict.summary: Tzatziki is generally safe for those with coeliac disease as it primarily consists of yogurt, cucumber, and herbs, which are gluten-free. However, cross-contamination risks can arise from shared preparation surfaces or utensils.

disclaimer: This guidance is informational only. Always verify ingredients and preparation with the restaurant.

sections.title: Quick answer
sections.body: Tzatziki can vary by recipe, ingredients, and cross-contact controls in the kitchen.

sections.title: Common gluten risks
sections.body: Watch for hidden sources like soy sauce, malt flavoring, marinades, thickeners, and shared fryers.

faq.question: What should I ask a restaurant?
faq.answer: Ask about shared equipment, sauces, marinades, and whether the kitchen has a dedicated gluten-free prep area.
